byline.original: By JENNY ANDERSON  and ANDREW ROSS SORKIN

headline.main: Health Coverage for All Americans (2 Letters)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: As Bob Herbert advocates in ''When Dollars Trump Compassion'' (column, June 19), we should, of course, insure and provide medical treatment to all children. But without universal health care, children could grow up to become uninsured adults. And adults with untreated chronic or serious health conditions could be unable to care for their children, whether the children are sick or healthy.
docs.abstract: Two letters comment on June 19 column about providing medical insurance and treatment to all children; Victoria Cherney says without providing health coverage for all Americans, children will remain at risk; Dr Barbara Gold wonders why parents who are uninsured are ashamed rather than angry

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers respond to Bob Herbert's June 5 column, "The Passion of Al Gore."
docs.abstract: Readers respond to Bob Herbert's June 5 column, "The Passion of Al Gore." Gil Greene, Columbus, Ohio: You asked Gore an excellent question about what he owed the country given his analysis and solutions. Gore may not be good at politics as it is played now but on a bad day he is still better [...]
